title.narrative: Sahel Adaptive Social Protection Programme

description.narrative: Danmark kan afhjælpe konsekvenser af COVID-19 for de meste sårbare grupper ved at bidrage til at udbygge de sparsomme sociale sikkerhedsnet i Sahel. Indsatsen vil afhjælpe udfordringer på kort sigt (3-6 måneder), såsom sult, og samtidig opbygge kapacitet til at imødegå fremtidige chok som følge af klimaforandringer (tørke/oversvømmelser), konflikt, fordrivelse og irregulær migration. De sociale sikkerhedsnet har særligt fokus på at styrke tilpasningsevne til chok og bidrager fx med kontantbaseret hjælp og jobskabelse m.v. At kunne nå de mest sårbare, herunder personer med handicap, er en af hovedprioriteterne med sociale sikkerhedsnet.

participating-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

title.narrative: Data and information: 3) Early Warning System
Enhancement of the predictive tool on food insecurity
Government and institutional arrangements: Supporting the shock response coordination framework and its implementation with the World Food Program
Focus on enhancing the partnership with WFP throughout FY21 with a focus on developing joint tools for program implementation and communication.
Niger activities
Strengthen social protection
Mauritania activities
Improve social protection
Burkina Faso activities
Planned acticities to increase social protection in the Sahel.
Poverty and vulnerability: Component 1: Types of shocks to which SP systems can be more responsive in the region and the impact these shocks have on the persistence of poverty
Analysis of the relationship between poverty and shocks using WAEMU household survey for five ASP countries
Programs and delivery systems: Strengthening Early Warning System

undertake a review of the processes to gather local level data and the overall data collection protocol in the aim of recommending tweaks for improvement and automize inputs which would go into vulnerability maps
Government Leadership and institutional arrangements: Strengthening Institutional and regulatory framework for ASP
Continue dialogue with Government and counterparts on the integration and prominence of ASP in new strategy and develop M&E framework
Finance: Disaster Risk Finance Strategy for Burkina
Begin the stock taking exercise on financing instruments currently available to the Government
Data and information: Improving the government’s capacity to monitor and evaluate safety nets

Finalize tweaks to the behavioral accompanying measures in line with the findings from the first IE
The team will finalize a study it has begun on the impacts of public works which was halted due to Covid.
Government Leadership and institutional arrangements
Technical assistance to the legal and institutional framework, particularly on targeting and registry governance.
Government Leadership and institutional arrangements: Enhance sector coordination and linkages with the other government programs
The World Bank Senegal team will work towards developing and agreeing on a common action plan with WFP throughout FY21
Programs and delivery system: Enhance the quality of the social safety net program
Design an exit strategy for beneficiaries based on providing productive support and linking households to social programs or state services
Finance: Enhance adaptive social protection financing mechanisms
The team will undertake a diagnostic of the shock response financing in Senegal upon which it will build a longer-term financing strategy
Technical assistance for the shock-responsive program and resilience activities
Design the economic inclusion package
Mali activities
Strengthen social protection
Forced displacement and fragility: Component 2: ASP operational implications in settings of fragility and FD
Review ongoing and new WB refugee operations in Sahel and similar context
Shock responseive delivery systems: Component 3: Disaster risk financing and insurance strategy for shock-responsive social protection
Assessment of financing needs for shock response and stock taking of risk financing instruments and concepts
Programs and delivery systems: Technical assistance to scale up delivery systems
Throughout FY 21 the team will work on upgrading the basic ASP tools with a strong focus on MIS and a review of potential payment mechanism options
Data and information: Technical support to the Early Warning System
Review data collection tools and data collection protocols, and update these tools and processes to ensure higher quality and more timely available data
Productive inclusion and women’s empowerment: Component 3: Policy dialogue, dissemination and just-in-time TA
Prepare regional technical workshop to disseminate operational lessons
Finance: Social Protection Public Expenditure Review
Launch of the expenditure review of the country’s social protection system. It comprises an assessment of the main social protection schemes in terms of coverage, expenditure and benefit levels

Strengthen social protection

Continue dialogue with Government and counterparts on the integration and prominence of ASP in new strategy and develop M&E framework
Government leadership and institutional arrangements: 1) Institutionalization and implementation of the Government’s permanent shock-response framework

Establish the standard operating procedures related to the SR framework that will detail responsibilities to draft, supervise and assess annual response plan related to food and nutritional insecurity
Finance: Review of insurance systems to cover those affected by shocks
Gather information on the existing insurance systems in Chad and benchmark of options
Programs and delivery systems: Design and pilot cash transfer program to respond to rapid onset shocks
Review data and evidence on climate data to assess the flood risk in Niger and inform the design of a flood response program.
Data and information: Development of the social registry
The team will continue dialogue with partners and the CFS on the set up of the registry and develop options on potential architectures

title.narrative: Data and information: Strengthen the USR as a core tool to improve equity and coordination of social protection including shock responses
